column4: Hey guys, I'm getting a repeated error in syslog that says this: [drm:r600_audio_bits_per_sample] *ERROR* Unknown bits per sample 0xf using 16 instead.
Anybody know what it means and how to fix it
Two of my monitors fail to start when it happens
like, 25% of the time on boot up.  If the machine boots correctly, its happy.
If its an ATI card, it won't use vesa
Its use the radeon driver, most likely
ist there a good opensource driver for the radeon?
Copernic, the "radeon" driver I use is supposed to be the open source one
I used to use fglrx and didn't have this problem, but I had others
did you get my last message?  I forgot the spaces in your name
tek, what do you mean a decent server?
yes, well I don't have much experiance with radeon, so I cant help you
np.  Anybody else know what the error [drm:r600_audio_bits_per_sample] *ERROR* Unknown bits per sample 0xf using 16 instead. means?
